title: Krispy Kreme opens 5th N.J. store
body: Krispy Kreme opened its newest New Jersey location in Paramus.Krispy Kreme Doughnuts has opened its fifth New Jersey location in Bergen County.The newest store is located at 247 Route 4 in Paramus. It joins locations in Springfield, East Rutherford, Jersey City, and Collingswood.The doughnut shop took the place of a . Both the storefront and drive-through are open from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. “Hot light” hours, when fresh doughnuts are being made, run from 6 a.m. to 10 a.m., and 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. daily.And if you’ve been vaccinated against the coronavirus already, your doughnut could be free. The chain is offering  each day for customers who show their vaccination cards.Note to readers: if you purchase something through one of our affiliate links we may earn a commission.
